title: REVIEW --- Play: News Quiz
text:
B. 3

C. 10

D. 30

---

2. South Korean bookstores, in keeping with that country's laws, halted sales of a memoir by North Korea's founding father. What's it called?

A. "A Heartbreaking Work of Staggering Genius"

B. "The Liars' Club"

C. "Darkness Visible"

D. "With the Century"

---

3. Elon Musk said that Tesla suspended accepting bitcoin from car buyers. Why?

A. Tesla's bitcoin wallet was already bulging.

B. Fossil fuel use in bitcoin mining

C. Cryptocurrency volatility

D. Fears the funds could come from illegal activities

---

4. A Dallas judge threw the National Rifle Assn. out of Chapter 11. What reason did he give?

A. The NRA wanted to pay creditors in ammo.

B. The filing should have been made in Delaware.

C. The filing was made to ward off a suit by New York's attorney general.

D. The organization's assets far exceed liabilities.

---

5. What are Catholic priests in Germany doing despite a Vatican ban?

A. Ordaining women

B. Approving birth control

C. Blessing same-sex couples

D. All of the above

---

6. U.S. District Judge Yvonne Gonzalez Rogers is presiding over an important antitrust case. Which one?

A. United States v. Microsoft

B. Epic v. Apple

C. Texas et al. v. Google

D. Rice v. Norman Williams

---

7. SoftBank is scaling back its investment in the "Nasdaq whale." Who's the big cetacean?

A. Amazon

B. Apple

C. Japan's top whaling company

D. A SoftBank unit that made big tech bets

---

8. Kentucky Derby winner Medina Spirit failed a post-race drug test. What was found in the horse's blood at twice the legal limit?

A. Erythropoietin

B. Betamethasone

C. Creatine

D. Viagra

---

ANSWERS

1. C

2. D

3. B

4. C

5. C

6. B

7. D

8. B
